did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Memorabilia, Newspapers, Photographs, Printed Materials, Publications
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Brotherwood Wine Company ephemera, including brochures, newspaper clippings, and other printed material

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: The Brotherhood winery was established by a European emigre, John Jaques, who produced the first commercial vintage in 1839 under the label "Blooming Grove Winery". Brotherhood has been in continuous operation since that time. In 1858 the property and winery was deeded to Mr. Jaques' three sons, John Jr, Oren, and Charles, and renamed "Jacques Brothers' Winery". In 1886, Charles, the last surviving brother, sold the winery to a father and son, Jesse M. and Edward R. Emerson. They renamed the winery Brotherhood. Jesse Emerson and his son expanded the facility, adding the "landmark" stone building with additional underground cellars that are the largest in the country. Edward, who was author of "The Story of the Vine", was in control of the winery in 1919 when prohibition was enacted. Having survived prohibition by the sale of sacramental wine, the winery again changed ownership around 1921. Louis Farrell and his son Louis L. Jr acquired a controlling interest in the Brotherhood Winery and ran it until 1947 when Louis Farrell Sr. died. His son died shortly thereafter, and the Winery was then managed by three Farrell cousins, one of whom, Francis Farrell, led the Winery into the post-WWII era. The winery underwent dramatic changes - major expansion, the beginning of a visitor tour operation and the creation of a broad range of award-winning wines. Brotherhood remained a "family business" until a change of ownership in January of 1987. Brotherhood Winery is listed in the New York State Register of Historic Places and is listed as a National Historic Landmark and uses the slogan "America's Oldest Winery".

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: If existing, 10 year restriction on administrative records; 25 year restriction on financial records of the current company; 75 year restriction on any wine formulations.
Copyrighted material requires the approval of Brotherhood Wine Company for publication.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Brotherhood Wine Company Records, #6701. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Forms part of the Eastern Wine and Grape Archive. (EWGA)

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See also the book The Story of Brotherhood, America's Oldest Winery by Robert Bedford.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series V. Wine Regulation and License File
Box: 4

scopecontent.p: Includes employees who worked from 1938-1948 and 1938-1941. Also letter from Baeza recognizing the death of Edward Jaques McLaughlin.

did.unittitle: Copy of an overview of Brotherhood winery history.

scopecontent.p: Also transcript from the Congressional Record of a May 17, 1989 House of Representatives session in which Representative Benjamin A. Gilman mentions the 150th anniversary of Brotherhood. Also copy of a May 16, 2000 letter from Ruth L. Pierpont acknowledging the winery's listing on the National Register of Historic Places. List of Brotherhood winemakers. Ca. 2004 price list.
Includes supply invoices and Jaques Brothers sales brochure from ca 1860. Material found in the wall of a house during a remodel.

did.unittitle: Daily diary, includes wine notes and weather notes.

scopecontent.p: Includes Price list from 1875, 1891, 1904 color reproductions of some items made from the CD that is included in the collection.

did.unittitle: United States Internal Revenue gauger's daily report
Administrative documents regarding Idanthea Emerson's Will and alcohol tax unit, and a Brotherhood Christmas card.

scopecontent.p: Contains scans of 1899 price booklet, assorted 1900 ephemera items, 1900 brochure with information about a trip to Washington to discuss the champagne making process and purity with the Senate, several 1989 photos, 1978 port label.
Includes Brotherhood Corporation, Jerusalem Wines, and Goshen Inn

did.unittitle: Assorted wine bottle lables, not all from Brotherhood

scopecontent.p: Includes Japanese market labels.
Also see Boxes 5 and 6

did.unittitle: Advertising, includes booklet on how to create advertising that sells from Ogilvy & Mather.

scopecontent.p: Also see Boxes 5 and 6

did.unittitle: Winery sketches by E. J. McGlaugin
Certificate for Dissolution of Brotherhood Wine Company, includes letter of terms.
Event entertainment brochures and information, includes fireworks, singers, Up With People, ticketing. Includes Give a Wine Tasting Party brochure, also available as TP548.5.A5 N49 1966.
Hot air baloon company information, includes Boland Baloon and Fantasy Ballon Flights Inc.
Catering information, includes Fabulous Foods Inc.
A Day at the Races promotion
Associated Hudson Valley tourism industry brochures collected by Brotherhood
Orange County New York advertising correspondence
Dillon Gordon ad agency advertisements, includes radio spots
Genghis Khan ginseng wine advertisements and promotional material label
Product information on Calesa Vina and Schapiro's Kosher wines.
Photocopies of articles, clippings, product information
Large information sales brochures for retailers and restaurants

scopecontent.p: Information regarding custom labeling.

did.unittitle: Real estate listing package about the winery.
Packet about the winery for sales representatives.

scopecontent.p: Includes photocopied press clippings, photo of Cesar Baeza, labels and descriptions for the entire product line, photocopies of a letter and certificate from the American Wine Society presenting a silver medal from a competition.

did.unittitle: Situation analysis and strategic recommendation report compiled by Seaward Associates Inc.

scopecontent.p: Covers all aspects of the wineries operations and gives suggestions for the future.

did.unittitle: Brotherhood Winery Project. Consultation report on winery operations.

scopecontent.p: Appears unprofessionally done, perhaps a school project. Written by someone named Warren. Includes recommendations for the future.

did.unittitle: Oversized items, posters, advertising, , artwork proofs for publications.
Oversized items, posters, advertising, news article, artwork proofs for publications. Also blueprints for the winery.

scopecontent.p: Photos of people include John J. Gleason August 1938, Lester Pee Wee Alexander, Hampton Hall, Hamilton Hall, Joseph Nemeth, Chester Rusclinski, Tom Quinn, Elsie, Brenda MacMillan, Diane Newlander, Joseph Monostori, Cesar Baeza. One of the early photo folders contains an envelope with cards that have biographical information regarding some of the employees in the photos. Champagne finishing room 1904, older photos, photocopies of photos, photos from wine tours, some marked for publication, some with descriptions, winery equipment, winemaster Capitol sales meeting 4-30-76, photos of events ca. 2000, product photos, operations, etc. Includes negatives and contact sheets.

did.unittitle: Winery operations, includes barrels, cask cleaning.
Gloria Okun cooking at Brotherhood, includes recipes
Promotional photos of Diane Newlander, Brenda McMillan, and Rebecca J. Baxter at Brotherhood
Color photos of winery operations, some with captions
Color photos of winery and events
Events, includes Harvest Grape Festival, people
Norwegian (Norway) Councilate and Lions Club event at Brotherhood
Negatives of a store bottle display
Personal photos, includes tennis event, craft shop candle and sign maker, Gasho Farm House resteraunt
Brotherhood booth at a fair, possibly the New York State Fair
Promotional photos of retailers and wine stores

scopecontent.p: Loose letterbook copies of correspondence from Louis L. Farrell from 1920s-1940s. Includes some originals of incoming correspondence. Appears incomplete. Some letters are marked as from the President of Brotherhood others are marked as from Vice President, letters marked Vice President may be from Louis Farrell Jr.

Letterbook pages are acidic and very fragile. Handle with care. Folders titled by letter are not in any order. Folders titled with a specific name are arranged in reverse chronologic order. For these folders please maintain correct date order when viewing.
Leocadie appears to be Louis' sister.

did.unittitle: Covington, Burling, & Rublee, Marion P. Wormhoudt

scopecontent.p: Letters discuss the distribution of Brotherhood stock owned by Edward R. Emerson to his wife. Includes a distribution check showing the amount the estate of E. R. Emerson received. Also included is a page describing how Brotherhood stock is valued. Letters have mention of a Mrs. Moffat as well.
Adelaide appears to be Louis' sister.
Adelaide appears to be Louis' sister.

scopecontent.p: L. M. Martini. Letters discuss orders, sacramental wine specifics, dealings with clergy on getting approval of wines, rules of the Catholic Church pertaining to wine.

did.unittitle: Scott and Sneed Attorneys and Counselors at Law and J. Bradley Scott
E. M. Sheehan & Company Merchandisng Agents
A. H. Sweeny and Van Alsyne, Noel, and Company Inc.

scopecontent.p: Mostly regarding mortgages and property. Irving Ottenberg, Benedict S. Wise, Agnes Bradley.

did.unittitle: Older letterbook copies mostly letter K and J.
Miscellaneous letterbook copy pages, bank receipts

scopecontent.p: Includes Jacquin's four compartment bottle, coffee pot bottle, articles, Julius Wile Sons & Co. Inc
Includes handwritten drafts for publications.

did.unittitle: Bully Hill and Keuka Lake Wine

scopecontent.p: Includes Walter S. Taylor, Fingerlakes Wine Museum, Winemaker's Shop, Lake Keuka Wine Company, Pleasant Valley Wine Company, Greyton H. Taylor Wine Museum.
Includes Taittinger and Taylor Wine Company.
Includes Yugoslavia, Hungary, Greece.
Also includes Pleasant Valley Wine Company.
Includes Great River Winery.
Includes Mark Miller, Benmarl Vineyards, and Hudson River Valley Association, now Regent Champagne Cellars.
Includes Royal Wine Corporation, Kosher wines, Pleasant Valley Wine Company, Great Western.
Includes information on Willy Frank.

did.unittitle: Liquor and Spirits Brochures and Information

scopecontent.p: Includes Hiram Walker, Seagram's, Tanqueray, Sake, W. A. Taylor and Co., Thomas Hine and Company Jarnac Cognac Brandy.

Includes articles, clippings, retailer brochures, ephemera. Esposito's, Barry Wine Company, Boordy Vineyards, Frederick S. Johnson Estate Wines, Herman A. Kluxen Wines of New Jersey, Munson Shaw, His Majesty's Spirits, Coleman & Company, Schieffelin, Domecq, Brotherhood, Wine Growing and Wine Types.
Includes Buchman & Buchman Law Offices.
Includes Greyton Hoyt Taylor Wine Museum.

did.unittitle: Wines & Vines and Wine Institute Publications

scopecontent.p: Includes 1975 Wines & Vines directory listing for Brotherhood
Includes booklet The Wines of the East The Hybrids by Hudson Catell and H. Lee Stauffer.
Includes text for a draft wine lecture.
Racks for home and business. Includes the Wine Well.
Some clippings mention Brotherhood
Clippings from a column from the New York Times by Frank J. Prial, Widmer mentioned in one article.

did.unittitle: Series V. Wine Regulation and License File

scopecontent.p: Wine regulations, liquor laws, forms, press clippings and other licensing information organized by State. Also Brotherhood specific forms, licenses, and liquor control offices correspondence.

did.unittitle: Notes mentioning States to be included for proposed marketing expansion.

scopecontent.p: Includes Appellation New York State event program, descriptions of other NY Wineries, 1976 and Privileges of NYS Winery License, 1981
Includes many Brotherhood wine bottle labels. Department of Liquor Control, correspondence.

Brochures, event ephemera, holiday promotions, letter regarding production of altar wines from the Archdiocese of New York to Frank L. Farrell, dealer letters and signage, labels, original order retained.
Event ephemera, wine tour info, brochures, order forms, advertisements, gold card VIP promotion material, original order retained.
Clippings, event ephemera, winery balloon festival advertising plan, advertisements, original order retained.
Contains newspaper clippings mentioning Brotherhood.
Contains newspaper clippings mentioning Brotherhood some press releases.
Clippings, ephemera, etc.
Contains newspaper clippings mentioning Brotherhood.
Contains holiday letters, brochures, and other ephemera.
Contains newspaper clippings mentioning Brotherhood.

did.unittitle: Sales ledger October 1939 - August 1944 and 1960s Scrapbook

scopecontent.p: This item is a ledger that was reused as a scrapbook portfolio for 1960s items. The information contained in the ledger is still mostly legible, but in some places 1960s scrapbook items have been glued in over the ledger text. The scrapbook items include newspaper clippings, and advertising, and other winery ephemera.
Ledger books of various sizes containing financial statements, budgets, employee pay, income, trial balances, sales, expenses, shipping logs, etc.

Ledgers are in chronologic order as found on the guide. Since the ledgers are all similar please replace them in the box in the same order so that they can be identified easily in the future. Each ledger has a strip of paper on the inside cover that lists the title as found on the guide. Fragile and dirty. Handle with care. Apron advised.
Includes meeting minutes of the Board of Directors, stockholder meetings, by laws, official documents.

did.unittitle: Check ledger, expenses (Orange and red leather)

scopecontent.p: Includes cask capacities and gallons of types of wine stored.

did.unittitle: Sales record (Large, metal bindings, cover says Sales Record)
Cash record (Large, metal bindings, cover says Cash Record)

scopecontent.p: Includes sales receipts, expenses by subject, cash, accounts receivable, interest, cooperage, etc.

Ledger book (Cover has a sticker that says Trial Balance)
Sales ledger (Black, faded yellow sticker on the cover)

did.unittitle: Incomplete ledger (Dirty black and red sticker on cover, covers not attached)

scopecontent.p: Includes information on wine, empty barrels, and kegs returned, and has some order in the back.

did.unittitle: Company finances ledger (Black, remains of a sticker on the cover)
Sales ledger (Black, cover has a sticker that says Brotherhood Corporation)

scopecontent.p: Sales figures for House, J.W.F, J.A.A., C.F.F., and M+M.

did.unittitle: Ledger book, in part for a movie theater

scopecontent.p: Has financial, bank checking, information from employees including L. L. Farrell. Some information about wine and kegs returned. A large portion appears to be a movie theater ledger book. Lists income and expenses from movie titles with lists of features shown. Also expenses from movie sound equipment. Includes a brief description of what type of movie each was and which studio produced it, Columbia, Metro, etc.

did.unittitle: Order account book (Grey, design on cover, loose binding)

scopecontent.p: Includes names and addresses of accounts. Some laid in order correspondence.

did.unittitle: Time book (Black and red, says Time Book on cover)

scopecontent.p: Includes employee hours worked and wages paid.

did.unittitle: Ledger book (Black says JOURNAL on the spine)
Alphabetic ledger (Black, poor shape, cover not attached)

scopecontent.p: Cash, sales receipts, expenses by subject.

scopecontent.p: Includes bank balances, payroll, payments.
Includes bank balances, payroll, payments.

scopecontent.p: This item is a ledger that was reused as a scrapbook portfolio for 1960s items. The information contained in the ledger is still mostly legible, but in some places 1960s scrapbook items have been glued in over the ledger text. The scrapbook items include newspaper clippings, and advertising, and other winery ephemera.
